Merge branch '4.0'

  [DI] fix CS
  [HttpKernel] Call Response->setPrivate() instead of sending raw header() when session is started
  [FrameworkBundle] Make cache:clear "atomic" and consistent with cache:warmup
  Suggest to write an implementation if the interface cannot be autowired
  [Debug] Skip DebugClassLoader checks for already parsed files
  ...

  fixed #25440
  empty lines don't count for indent detection

  [Lock] Fix incorrect phpdoc
  [Process] Dont rely on putenv(), it fails on ZTS PHP
  [HttpKernel] detect deprecations thrown by container initialization during tests
  [HttpKernel] Fix logging of post-terminate errors/exceptions
  [DI] Add context to service-not-found exceptions thrown by service locators
  [Debug] Fix catching fatal errors in case of nested error handlers
  ...

  parse newlines in quoted multiline strings
  Fix collision between view properties and form fields

  [SecurityBundle] Fix compat with HttpFoundation >=3.4

  Fix collision between view properties and form fields

[2.7][DX] Use constant message contextualisation for deprecations

issue_comments.body: Deplacement sur symfony/symfony

commits.message: empty lines don't count for indent detection

fix some edge cases with indented blocks

Now that comment-like lines are no longer ignored when subparsers are
created, we need to ignore them in some functions (e.g. when detecting
the indentation depth of the next block).

do not evaluate PHP constant names

PHP constant identifiers must be strings anyway. Thus, we only need to
parse quoted strings, but do not have to evaluate the data types.

issue_comments.body: see symfony/symfony#25043

commits.message: Remove some unused variables and properties

issue_comments.body:
pull requests should be sent to symfony/symfony. The subtree splits are marked as read-only in their description, which means that only the cron job updating them from the symfony repo writes in them.

there is currently a discussion to see if it could be possible to accept pull requests coming both ways but we haven't set up the needed tools yet (or even figured if it can be done reliably)

Yeah sorry, I realized that just today as I read the conversation about this on the dev mailing list. Perhaps a reminder in the README would do it as I think a lot of people don't read that little note at the top.

Yeah sorry, I realized that just today as I read the conversation about this on the dev mailing list. Perhaps a reminder in the README would do it as I think a lot of people don't read that little note at the top.
This is a minor change to the internal private API and does not affect the public API. Hence we can propose for this to come in Symfony YAML v2.2.2
I've made the PR to the main symfony/symfony repository
See PR #7 for the right version
Thnx for cofirmation. I was wandering if my approach is by-the-spec.

@stevenjack, looking at the issue again, we can use the Yaml merge as an array, to merge multiple maps, which then produces our required output. I have tried this in our codebase and it gives us the output required.

http://yaml.org/type/merge.html

``` yaml
---
- &CENTER { x: 1, y: 2 }
- &BIG { r: 10 }

- # Merge multiple maps
  << : [ *CENTER, *BIG ]
  label: center/big
```

Having shown this, it would be good to get this merged, as this allows multiple aliases without having to add them into a single array.
Closing - this is the same issue reported here https://github.com/symfony/symfony/issues/12478

I add this because I would like to represent binary data in .yaml file loaded by PHPUnit_Extensions_Database_DataSet_YamlDataSet() for MySQL tables setup.

E.g. both "\x80\x81" or 0x8081 cannot represent, because "\x80\x81" are treated as two latin1 characters and converted to UTF-8 bytes after loading, and 0x8081 may have integer overflow problem for long binary data.

I didn't realise that tests weren't run on travis on this repo. Is this the right place to make PR ?

symfony/symfony#15241
Wrong repo. All PRs must go to symfony.
This repo is readonly.

**This is a read only repository.**

Pull Request should be send to https://github.com/symfony/symfony.
After the merge in the main repository, a sub-tree of split is done and this repository is updated.

**This is a read only repository.**

Pull Request should be send to https://github.com/symfony/symfony.
After the merge in the main repository, a sub-tree of split is done and this repository is updated.
Did not mean to create this here.

commit_comments.body:
Hey there @fabpot Can you test it using no spaces like "#comment 1". Because I am using CI and updated the symfony/yaml 2 hours ago and that broke my Behat tests using .yml configuration saying that " [Symfony\Component\Yaml\Exception\ParseException]  
  Unable to parse at line 31 (near "        VerticalTab: ".vertical-tabs""). "
From my investigation I noticed that previous row have a comment like this - "#regions" and if I change it to - "# regions" it works fine

  [DI] Fix missing unset leading to false-positive circular ref
  [DI] Fix deep-inlining of non-shared refs
  parse newlines in quoted multiline strings
  Fix collision between view properties and form fields
  Fix collision between view properties and form fields
  [SecurityBundle] Fix compat with HttpFoundation >=3.4
  [DI] turn $private to protected in dumped container, to make cache:clear BC
  Fix collision between view properties and form fields
Update LICENSE year... forever
[2.7][DX] Use constant message contextualisation for deprecations

issue_comments.body: Deplacement sur symfony/symfony

commits.message: empty lines don't count for indent detection

fix some edge cases with indented blocks

Now that comment-like lines are no longer ignored when subparsers are
created, we need to ignore them in some functions (e.g. when detecting
the indentation depth of the next block).

do not evaluate PHP constant names

PHP constant identifiers must be strings anyway. Thus, we only need to
parse quoted strings, but do not have to evaluate the data types.

issue_comments.body: see symfony/symfony#25043

commits.message: Remove some unused variables and properties

issue_comments.body:
pull requests should be sent to symfony/symfony. The subtree splits are marked as read-only in their description, which means that only the cron job updating them from the symfony repo writes in them.

there is currently a discussion to see if it could be possible to accept pull requests coming both ways but we haven't set up the needed tools yet (or even figured if it can be done reliably)

Yeah sorry, I realized that just today as I read the conversation about this on the dev mailing list. Perhaps a reminder in the README would do it as I think a lot of people don't read that little note at the top.

Thnx for cofirmation. I was wandering if my approach is by-the-spec.

@stevenjack, looking at the issue again, we can use the Yaml merge as an array, to merge multiple maps, which then produces our required output. I have tried this in our codebase and it gives us the output required.

http://yaml.org/type/merge.html

``` yaml
---
- &CENTER { x: 1, y: 2 }
- &BIG { r: 10 }

- # Merge multiple maps
  << : [ *CENTER, *BIG ]
  label: center/big
```

Having shown this, it would be good to get this merged, as this allows multiple aliases without having to add them into a single array.
Closing - this is the same issue reported here https://github.com/symfony/symfony/issues/12478

I add this because I would like to represent binary data in .yaml file loaded by PHPUnit_Extensions_Database_DataSet_YamlDataSet() for MySQL tables setup.

E.g. both "\x80\x81" or 0x8081 cannot represent, because "\x80\x81" are treated as two latin1 characters and converted to UTF-8 bytes after loading, and 0x8081 may have integer overflow problem for long binary data.

symfony/symfony#15241
Wrong repo. All PRs must go to symfony.
This repo is readonly.

**This is a read only repository.**

Pull Request should be send to https://github.com/symfony/symfony.
After the merge in the main repository, a sub-tree of split is done and this repository is updated.

After the merge in the main repository, a sub-tree of split is done and this repository is updated.

commit_comments.body:
Hey there @fabpot Can you test it using no spaces like "#comment 1". Because I am using CI and updated the symfony/yaml 2 hours ago and that broke my Behat tests using .yml configuration saying that " [Symfony\Component\Yaml\Exception\ParseException]  
  Unable to parse at line 31 (near "        VerticalTab: ".vertical-tabs""). "
From my investigation I noticed that previous row have a comment like this - "#regions" and if I change it to - "# regions" it works fine
